titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Or 2487: Perush Shemot

availability.licence: These images and the content of British Library Or 2487: Perush Shemot are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, British Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about British Library Or 2487: Perush Shemot. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary on the book of Exodus (fragments).

supportDesc.extent: 112 folios (+ 2 paper flyleaves at the beginning and at the end). Part I: Folios 1-90. Part II: Folios 91-112.;

layoutDesc.layout: Part I: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 21; written lines: 21; Visible ruling with a mastara. Catchwords on every verso. Part II: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 26; written lines: 26; Visible ruling with a mastara. Catchwords on every verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 16th to 17th century.Part I: Oriental semi-cursive of 16 and 17th century.Part II: Oriental semi-cursive script of 16th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Samuel Ha-Rofe. Comm. On Exodus. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2487.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [113v] .
